M.G.L. c. 186 (Landlord and Tenant statu.proposition: Under Massachusetts law, tenants are entitled to the covenant (express and/or implied) of quiet enjoyment: the right to possession and use of the leased premises without substantial interference by the landlord or others acting with the landlord’s knowledge or consent. The landlord is obligated to take reasonable steps to abate substantial interferences of which the landlord has notice.
